meanings.definition: Continue to have (something); keep possession of.
meanings.sent1: She retains her favorite toy for many years.
meanings.sent2: He retains ownership of the old house.
meanings.sent3: The magician retains the audience's attention with his tricks.
meanings.sent4: The old tree retains the memories of the children who used to play under its branches.
meanings.sent5: The antique shop retains a sense of history and charm.

meanings.sent1: He retains the lyrics of his favorite song in his mind.
meanings.sent2: She retains the details of the story even after many years.
meanings.sent3: The student retains the formula by repeating it out loud.
meanings.sent4: The photograph retains the happy moments of the family reunion.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh cookies retains in her memory from childhood.

meanings.sent1: The company retains its employees by offering good benefits.
meanings.sent2: She retains her clients by providing excellent customer service.
meanings.sent3: The chef retains the customers by introducing new dishes regularly.
meanings.sent4: The coach retains the players' trust by supporting them through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The teacher retains the students' interest by making the lessons interactive.
